senselogic.sitevision.api.message

Interface ChannelWrapper

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Wrapper<Node>

    public interface ChannelWrapper
extends Wrapper<Node>
    Channel administration interface.

    This wrapper provides methods to update an existing channel (node of type sv:topic).

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via MessagesFactory.getChannelWrapper(javax.jcr.Node). See MessagesFactory for how to obtain an instance of the MessagesFactory interface.

    Since:
    Sitevision 2024.03.01
    Author:
    Elias Abrache

    • Method Detail

      • addMember

        boolean addMember(Node aUserIdentity)
        Adds a user identity as member of the wrapped channel.

        Requires enabled Social collaboration, and for the operating user to have a social user identity.

        Only non-members will be added, i.e. a user identity that already is a member will be ignored. Channels that are archived don't accept any new members.

        Permission notes!

        Open channels require the operating user to have either membership or the PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_CHANNELS permission when adding members other than self.

        Private channels require the operating user to have membership.

        Parameters:
        aUserIdentity - a user identity (or user)
        Returns:
        true if aUserIdentity was added as member of the wrapped channel, false otherwise. false is always returned if aUserIdentity is null or already a member of the wrapped channel.

      • removeMember

        boolean removeMember(Node aUserIdentity)
        Removes a member from the wrapped channel.

        Only members can be removed, i.e. a user identity that is a non-member will be ignored. Members can not be removed from channels that are archived.

        Permission notes!

        Open channels require the operating user to have one of the following:

        • PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_CHANNELS permission.
        • Be channel administrator (author of the channel).
        • Operating user matches the user identity (i.e. "is yourself").

        Private channels require the operating user to have one of the following:

        • Membership and the PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_CHANNELS permission.
        • Be channel administrator (author of the channel).
        • Operating user matches the user identity (i.e. "is yourself").
        Parameters:
        aUserIdentity - a user identity (or user)
        Returns:
        true if aUserIdentity was removed as member from the wrapped channel, false otherwise. false is always returned if aUserIdentity is null or not a member of the wrapped channel.

      • isMember

        boolean isMember(Node aUserIdentity)
        Checks if a user identity is a member of the wrapped channel.
        Parameters:
        aUserIdentity - a user identity (or user)
        Returns:
        true if aUserIdentity is a member of the wrapped channel, false otherwise. false is always returned if aUserIdentity is null.
        Since:
        Sitevision 2024.05.01

      • renameChannel

        boolean renameChannel(String aChannelName)
        Alters the name of the wrapped channel.

        Permission note Only the author or members with the PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_CHANNELS permission can alter the channel name.

        The new channel name most not exceed 80 characters in length and must be unique otherwise false will be returned.

        Parameters:
        aChannelName - the new name of the channel
        Returns:
        true if channel could be renamed to aChannelName, false otherwise.
        Since:
        Sitevision 2024.05.01

      • setChannelDescription

        boolean setChannelDescription(String aChannelDescription)
        Alters the description of the wrapped channel.

        Permission note Only the author or members with the PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_CHANNELS permission can alter the channel description.

        Parameters:
        aChannelDescription - the new description of the channel
        Returns:
        true if channel description was set to aChannelDescription, false otherwise.
        Since:
        Sitevision 2024.05.01

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
